meanings.definition: Move along or out steadily and continuously in a current or stream.
meanings.sent1: The river will flow gently through the valley.
meanings.sent2: The water will flow from the faucet when you turn it on.
meanings.sent3: The traffic lights were synchronized perfectly, allowing cars to flow smoothly through the intersection.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to flow effortlessly, captivating everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The music flowed like a gentle breeze, soothing our souls.

meanings.definition: The action or fact of moving along in a steady, continuous stream.
meanings.sent1: The flow of the river was calm and peaceful.
meanings.sent2: The flow of information from the internet is endless.
meanings.sent3: The flow of customers into the store was steady throughout the day.
meanings.sent4: The flow of time seemed to speed up as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The flow of traffic in the city was chaotic during rush hour.

meanings.sent1: The conversation will flow naturally between friends.
meanings.sent2: Ideas will flow freely during the brainstorming session.
meanings.sent3: The dance performance flowed gracefully from one movement to the next.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to flow differently during the relaxing vacation.
meanings.sent5: Her creativity seemed to flow endlessly, inspiring those around her.
